intro: Polygala tanganyikensis, commonly known as the Lake Tanganyika milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Lake Tanganyika region in East Africa. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats along the shores of the lake. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
